CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A8, reads: "Real Cool Beatnik Party - The latest fad in fad-filled teen-age life is to act and dress like the beatniks, a new group in today's society determined to be non-conformists. This new fad has reached Pittsburgh.  The Les Amies Club demonstrates the 'beat look.'  Members of the club are, from left, first row: Nat Dunn, Pat McCoy, Joe Lewis, Louise Mason, Robert Snee, Bill Peeler and Shirley Montgomery.  Second row: Beverly Sloan, Bobby Towe, Shirley James, Lindsay Brooks, Judy Hopson, Rod Doss, Janice Need and Clyde Myers.  Standing: Donnie Brooks, Sandra Roberts, Phyllis Smith, James Coleman, Betsy Peyton, Billy Robinson and Ahaena Scott. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Les Amies Club including Nat Dunn, Pat McCoy, Joe Lewis, Louise Mason, Robert Snee, Bill Peeler, Shirley Montgomery, Beverly Sloan, Bobby Towe, Shirley James, Lindsay Brooks, Judy Hopson, Rod Doss, Janice Need, Clyde Myers, Donnie Brooks, Sandra Roberts, Phyllis Smith, James Coleman, Betsy Peyton, Billy Robinson, and Ahaena Scott.
